#summary Guide for installing KB CMS
#labels Featured

= Introduction =

This is a guide to install KB CMS on Ubuntu 7.04. Many of the steps may apply to other Ubuntu versions, other distributions or even other operating systems. This guide is specifically made for one certain setup for simplicity, but others may follow later.


= Details =

The initial setup can be done with a few commands in a terminal window. When it opens the text editor (nano), you need to change "AllowOverride None" in the "<Directory /var/www/>" section to "AllowOverride None".

{{{
# Add universe and multiverse repositories if not avilable and then update
sudo sed -i 's/^deb \([^ ]*\) \([^ ]*\) main restricted$/deb \1 \2 main restricted universe multiverse/' /etc/apt/sources.list
sudo apt-get update
# Install requires packages
sudo apt-get install php5 nautilus-script-collection-svn php5-xsl
# Download KB CMS and set it up
sudo chown -R `whoami` /var/www
rm -rf /var/www/apache2-default
svn checkout http://kbcms.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/ /var/www
sudo sed -i 's/AllowOverride None/AllowOverride All/g' /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/000-default
sudo ln -s ../mods-available/rewrite.load /etc/apache2/mods-enabled/
sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
}}}

The website should now be available at http://localhost.
